metadata.Title: CVE-2015-0825 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Stack-based buffer underflow in the mozilla::MP3FrameParser::ParseBuffer function in Mozilla Firefox before 36.0 allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information from process memory via a malformed MP3 file that improperly interacts with memory allocation during playback.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-0825` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 36.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
firefox-globalmenu - 36.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
firefox-mozsymbols - 36.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
firefox-testsuite - 36.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '36.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4').
